As stated in http://java.sun.com/javase/6/docs/api/java/awt/datatransfer/DataFlavor.html#javaSerializedObjectMimeType 
  it is application/x-java-serialized-object.

I do not know if it is really intended to be used for a transport via  
HTTP (it is actually used for drag and drop normally) but it is used  
e.g.  in Spring Framework's HTTP based endpoints.

Am 22.05.2009 um 03:23 schrieb Bill Burke:

> Anybody know of any de facto Java-based mime types?  I'm basically
> looking for ones that allow you to serialize Java objects as your
> message body.  I did not see any registered at Iana.
>
> -- 
> Bill Burke
> JBoss, a division of Red Hat
> http://bill.burkecentral.com
